title: Corrie and Broadchurch star Julie Hesmondhalgh is glad Roy and Cathy split | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 11:16 am (Picture: ITV) 
Former Coronation Street star Julie Hesmondhalgh has addressed the recent storyline which saw her on-screen widowed husband Roy Cropper split from his new fiancee Cathy Matthews – and has admitted that she agrees with the outcome as she could never feasibly imagine Roy settling with anyone else. 
The beloved actress, best known for playing the late Hayley, was speaking at a recent press conference which was held to promote her pivotal role in the third series of Broadchurch as rape victim Trish Winterman. 
When asked if she had kept up with Corrie since leaving, Julie spoke about the recent wedding episodes which saw Roy tell Cathy that he didn’t love her in that way. 
She explained: ‘I think it was a good choice, actually. I was really happy for him. Hayley would’ve been happy for him to move on, but as David (Neilson, who plays Roy) has always said, he’s so particular is Roy, and that’s what made it interesting for us in Corrie, because they couldn’t do anything with us. 
‘They couldn’t do all the usual sort of things like giving us affairs and all that, they had to make us interesting just in our coupledom, just in our very conservative coupledom. Realistically Roy would never be with anybody else, so I think it’s very true to that, that he’s gone back to being this lone wolf, wandering around. 
‘But I was very happy, and Mel (Hill, who plays Cathy)’s absolutely lovely and she’s so brilliant as well, but I think it was probably the right thing for him and for that character.’ 
Broadchurch will kick off a final eight episode run next week with David Tennant and Olivia Colman reprising their main roles as investigators Hardy and Miller. Metro.co.uk have seen the opening episode and Julie’s performance as Trish is harrowing and deeply moving. 
The series returns on Monday 27th February at 9pm on ITV.
